definition: survival of the fittest
surname Shi
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: Both documents challenge the notion of a dog-eat-dog society, where survival of the fittest reigns.
sentences.chinese: 兩份文書都對適者生存的弱肉強食社會觀念提出挑戰。

sentences.english: I relate it to the idea of survival of the fittest.
sentences.chinese: 我把它和人類學中適者生存的觀點聯繫起來了。

sentences.english: This number is subject to Darwin's "survival of the fittest" concept of the impact.
sentences.chinese: 這多是受到達爾文“適者生存”概念的影響。

sentences.english: Thick Hide, Dire Bear and Survival of the Fittest only affect base armor.
sentences.chinese: 厚皮，巨熊形態和適者生存隻影響基礎護甲值。

sentences.english: Is it part of the natural selection process?
sentences.chinese: 適者生存是物競天擇過程中的一部分嗎？

sentences.english: Life is a deadly struggle in which only the fittest survive.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物學，知道“適者生存”是天經地義。

sentences.english: As asserted by Darwin, only the fittest can survive.
sentences.chinese: 正如達爾文所言，物競天擇，適者生存。

sentences.english: But survival of the fittest doesn't always have life-or-death stakes.
sentences.chinese: 但適者生存並不總是生死攸關的事。

sentences.english: The growth of a large business is merely a survival of the fittest.
sentences.chinese: 一個大企業的成長也不過是適者生存而已。

sentences.english: Developing the “Survival of the Fittest” attitude so you can win in Dating and Business.
sentences.chinese: 樹立“適者生存”觀念，贏得愛情和事業。

sentences.english: But every good Darwinian system needs a ‘Survival of The Fittest’ force.
sentences.chinese: 但是每個完美的達爾文系統遵循”適者生存”。

sentences.english: The concept, drawing from evolution, espouses the philosophy of survival of the fittest.
sentences.chinese: 從進化角度來看，這一概念奉行“適者生存”的哲學。

sentences.english: Employ extremly intelligent young people and establish survival-of-the-fittest employment system.
sentences.chinese: 聘用絕頂聰明的年輕人，建立適者生存的用人機制。

sentences.english: Office Darwinism" is a bureaucratic form of "survival of the fittest."
sentences.chinese: 2“辦公室進化論”是“適者生存”的官方形式。

sentences.english: Evolution, the theory goes, guarantees survival to the fittest.
As a student of biology, Kao knew that "the survival of the fittest" was ordained by nature.
sentences.chinese: 高松年研究生物學，知道“適者生存”是天經地義。

definition: natural selection
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to be chivalrous
misconception/fallacy
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
feudalism
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom)/skulduggery/to hoodwink people/to cheat sb audaciously
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
